edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.models

Class ClinicalTrialModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.models.ClinicalTrialModel

  • public class ClinicalTrialModel
extends java.lang.Object
    The ClinicalTrialModel is a class that provides a central means of access to all of the information that a clinical trial provides. The model is shared among all of the views. At this time, the ClinicalTrialModel is not considered thread safe but, since the model is created on the UI thread and because the model is shared by all of the views this is not an issue at this time. The view model class provides properties for the trial and notifies listeners when those properties change. This design allows for UI controls to update themselves when the data they are bound to changes. The model itself is not much more than a wrapper for the Trial bean in that it internally calls the methods of the trial for the associated operations. At this time, only a single trial is associated with a view model. Although this particular view model is used in a JavaFX application, it does not use any JavaFX specified properties but, it does provide JavaFX Observable collections and values via some of the getters.
    Author:
    That Group

                       throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Sets the "selected" clinic to the specified clinic and notifies any listeners of this change. Typically the selected clinic is set in response to a UI event where the user selects a clinic from a list and that list then notifies this model of the change.
        Parameters:
        selectedClinic - the clinic that is now considered to be the "selected" clinic.
        Throws:
        edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException - indicates an error occurred while accessing the catalog.

      • addPropertyChangeListener

        public void addPropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Add a PropertyChangeListener to the listener list. The listener is registered for all properties. The same listener object may be added more than once, and will be called as many times as it is added. If listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        listener - - The PropertyChangeListener to be added

      • addClinic

        public boolean addClinic(java.lang.String clinicId,
                         java.lang.String name)
                  throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Adds the specified clinic to this model's trial with the specified name. Returns true if the clinic was added and false if the clinic was not added. A clinic can only be added to a trial once. Fires a PROP_CLINICS change notification
        Parameters:
        clinicId - the id of the clinic to add
        name - the name of the clinic, which may be null if the clinic doesn't have a name.
        Returns:
        true if the clinic was added and false if the clinic was not added.
        Throws:
        edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException - indicates an error occurred while accessing the catalog.

      • addPatient

        public boolean addPatient(java.lang.String patientId,
                          java.time.LocalDate startDate)
                   throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Adds the specified patient to this model's trial with the specified start date. Returns true if the patient was added and false if the patient was not added. A patient can only be added to a trial once. Fires a PROP_PATIENTS change notification
        Parameters:
        patientId - the id of the patient to add
        startDate - the date the patient started the trial, which may be null if the patient hasn't actually started the trial yet.
        Returns:
        true if the patient was added and false if the patient was not added.
        Throws:
        edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException - indicates an error occurred while accessing the catalog.

      • updateOrAdd

        public boolean updateOrAdd(edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.beans.Patient patient)
                    throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Updates the specified patient in the catalog. If the patient is not in the catalog, it is added. Returns true if the patient was updated and false if the patient was not. Fires a PROP_PATIENTS change notification if the patient was added to the catalog or a PROP_UPDATE_PATIENT if the patient was simply updated.
        Parameters:
        patient - the patient to update
        Returns:
        true if the patient was update and false if the patient was not.
        Throws:
        edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException - indicates an error occurred while accessing the catalog.

      • updateOrAdd

        public boolean updateOrAdd(edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.beans.Clinic clinic)
                    throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Updates the specified clinic in the catalog. If the patient is not in the catalog, it is added. Returns true if the clinic was updated and false if the clinic was not. Fires a PROP_CLINICS change notification if the clinic was added to the catalog or a PROP_UPDATE_CLINIC if the clinic was simply updated.
        Parameters:
        clinic - the clinic to update
        Returns:
        true if the clinic was update and false if the clinic was not.
        Throws:
        edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException - indicates an error occurred while accessing the catalog.

        public boolean updateOrAdd(edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.beans.Reading reading)
                    throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Updates the specified patient in the catalog. If the patient is not in the catalog, it is added. Returns true if the patient was updated and false if the patient was not. Fires a PROP_PATIENTS change notification if the patient was added to the catalog or a PROP_UPDATE_PATIENT if the patient was simply updated.
        Parameters:

      • importReading

        public boolean importReading(edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.beans.Reading reading)
                      throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Imports the specified reading. The currently selected patient and currently selected clinic are ignored. Importing differs from adding in that a patient simply has to be in the trial's list in order to import a reading for it whereas to add a reading, the patient must be currently active in the trial or the reading date must be within the active dates that the patient was in the trial.
        Parameters:
        reading - the reading to import.
        Returns:
        true if the reading was imported; otherwise false.
        Throws:
        edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException - indicates an error occurred while accessing the catalog.

      • importReading

        public boolean importReading(java.lang.String type,
                             java.lang.String id,
                             java.lang.Object value,
                             java.time.LocalDateTime date)
                      throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Imports the specified reading. The currently selected patient and currently selected clinic must be a valid patient and clinic reference. Importing differs from adding in that a patient simply has to be in the trial's list in order to import a reading for it whereas to add a reading, the patient must be currently active in the trial.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of reading that is being added
        id - the id of the reading being added
        value - the value of the reading being added
        date - the date the reading was taken
        Returns:
        true if the reading was imported; otherwise false.
        Throws:
        edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException - indicates an error occurred while accessing the catalog.

      • addReading

        public boolean addReading(edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.beans.Reading reading)
                   throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Adds the specified reading. The currently selected patient and currently selected clinic must be a valid patient and clinic reference. Adding differs from importing in that a patient must be currently active in the trial.
        Parameters:
        reading - the reading to add.
        Returns:
        true if the reading was imported; otherwise false.
        Throws:
        edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException - indicates an error occurred while accessing the catalog.

      • addReading

        public boolean addReading(java.lang.String type,
                          java.lang.String id,
                          java.lang.String patientId,
                          java.lang.String clinicId,
                          java.lang.Object value,
                          java.time.LocalDateTime date)
                   throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Adds the specified reading. The currently selected patient and currently selected clinic must be a valid patient and clinic reference. Adding differs from importing in that a patient must be currently active in the trial.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of reading that is being added
        id - the id of the reading being added
        patientId - the id of the associated patient
        clinicId - the id of the associated clinic
        value - the value of the reading being added
        date - the date the reading was taken
        Returns:
        true if the reading was imported; otherwise false.
        Throws:
        edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException - indicates an error occurred while accessing the catalog.

      • getPatient

        public edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.beans.Patient getPatient(java.lang.String patientId)
                                                                       throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Returns a reference to a patient for the specified patient id. If the patient doesn't exist the null reference is returned.
        Parameters:
        patientId - the patient id whose reference we are to retrieve. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the requested patient reference or null if the patient could not be found in this trial.
        Throws:
        edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException - indicates an error occurred while accessing the catalog.

      • getClinic

        public edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.beans.Clinic getClinic(java.lang.String clinicId)
                                                                     throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Returns a reference to a clinic for the specified clinic id. If the clinic doesn't exist the null reference is returned.
        Parameters:
        clinicId - the clinic id whose reference we are to retrieve. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the requested clinic reference or null if the clinic could not be found in this trial.
        Throws:
        edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException - indicates an error occurred while accessing the catalog.

      • getTrialId

        public java.lang.String getTrialId()
        Returns the id of the trial that this model is associated with.
        Returns:
        the id of the trial that this model is associated with.

      • isPatientInTrial

        public boolean isPatientInTrial(edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.beans.Patient patient)
        Returns true if the patient is considered to be in the trial. Please note that a return value of true does not mean the patient is currently active in the trial, it just means that the patient is considered to be or have been a part of this trial.
        Parameters:
        patient - The patient to check. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        true if the patient is considered to be in the trial; otherwise false.

      • hasPatientStartedTrial

        public boolean hasPatientStartedTrial(edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.beans.Patient patient)
        Returns true if the specified patient has started this trial
        Parameters:
        patient - The patient to check. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        answer true if the specified patient has started this trial

      • addPatient

        public boolean addPatient(java.lang.String patientId)
                   throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Adds the specified patient to this model's trial with no start date. Returns true if the patient was added and false if the patient was not added. A patient can only be added to a trial once. Fires a PROP_PATIENTS change notification
        Parameters:
        patientId - The id of the patient to add. Cannot be null
        Returns:
        answer true if the specified patient was added to this trial; otherwise false.
        Throws:
        edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException - indicates an error occurred while accessing the catalog.

      • canAddReading

        public boolean canAddReading(edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.beans.Reading reading,
                             boolean failIfExists)
                      throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Returns true if the specified reading can be added to the selected patient.
        Parameters:
        reading - the reading to add.
        failIfExists - if true and the reading already exists in the catalog, then false is returned.
        Returns:
        true if the specified reading can be added to the selected patient.
        Throws:
        edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException - indicates an error occurred while accessing the catalog.

      • addPatient

        public boolean addPatient(java.lang.String patientId,
                          java.time.LocalDate startDate,
                          java.time.LocalDate endDate)
                   throws edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException
        Adds the specified patient to this model's trial with the specified start and end dates. Returns true if the patient was added and false if the patient was not added. A patient can only be added to a trial once. Fires a PROP_PATIENTS change notification
        Parameters:
        patientId - the id of the patient to add
        startDate - the date the patient started the trial, which may be null if the patient hasn't actually started the trial yet.
        endDate - the date the patient ended the trial, which may be null.
        Returns:
        true if the patient was added and false if the patient was not added.
        Throws:
        edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.exceptions.TrialCatalogException - indicates an error occurred while accessing the catalog.
